parser

Class SymbolTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.SymbolTable

  • public class SymbolTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all symbols defined in the program and consolidates the logic to a single class.
    Author:
    meltd

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SymbolTable()
      Initializes a SymbolTable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SymbolTable

        public SymbolTable()
        Initializes a SymbolTable. Upon initialization, a "global table" is pushed on to the stack. Adds the pre-defined procedures write and read to the global table.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(java.lang.String identifier,
                   Kinds kind,
                   Keywords type,
                   java.lang.Integer start,
                   java.lang.Integer end)
        Allows for the addition of any symbol to the current table. Note, this will add to the table at the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        identifier, - name of the symbol being added.
        kind, - kind of symbol as defined by the Kinds enum.
        type, - Integer or Real.
        start, - start index of an array symbol.
        end, - end indec of an array symbol.
        Returns:
        whether the symbol was added. If false, the symbol already exists in the current table.

      • addFunctionReturn

        public boolean addFunctionReturn(java.lang.String identifier,
                                 Keywords type)
        Sets a return type to the specified function.
        Parameters:
        identifier, - name of function.
        type, - Integer or Real.
        Returns:
        returns true if current symbol table already contains the identifier.

      • pushTable

        public int pushTable(java.lang.String id,
                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Symbol> table)
        Used to push a procedure's table on to the stack.
        Parameters:
        id, - name of the procedure.
        table, - procedure's associated table.
        Returns:
        the size of the stack after the push.

      • popTable

        public int popTable()
        Pops the top table off of the stack.
        Returns:
        the size of the stack after the pop.

      • isVariableName

        public boolean isVariableName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the variable exists anywhere in the stack and is a variable.
        Parameters:
        name, - variable name.
        Returns:
        true if the variable has been declared.

        Returns:

      • getType

        public Keywords getType(java.lang.String id)
        Get the type of the most local symbol of this id.
        Parameters:
        id, - name of symbol.
        Returns:
        the type of symbol or null if the symbol does not exist.

      • getSymbols

        public java.util.Collection<Symbol> getSymbols()
        Get a collection of the symbols defined in the current table.
        Returns:
        a collect of symbols from the current table.

      • getSymbol

        public Symbol getSymbol(java.lang.String id)
        Get a symbol from the first table it's declared in on the stack.
        Parameters:
        id, - name of symbol.
        Returns:
        the most local symbol of that name or null if the symbol has not been declared.
